java_mcq_questions.question: What is Java?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A programming language

java_mcq_questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid Java variable name?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: 123variable

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'public' access modifier in Java?
options: To restrict access to a method
To make a class or method accessible from any other class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To make a class or method accessible from any other class

java_mcq_questions.question: Which keyword is used to create an instance of a class in Java?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: new

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the main method's signature in Java?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: public static void main(String[] args)

java_mcq_questions.question: In Java, which data type is used to store whole numbers?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: int

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the output of 'System.out.println(5 + "Java")' in Java?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: 5Java

java_mcq_questions.question: Which Java keyword is used to explicitly specify that a variable doesn't have a value?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: null

java_mcq_questions.question: What is an interface in Java?
options: A class that cannot be instantiated
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A class that cannot be instantiated

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in Java?
options: To refer to the current instance of the class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To refer to the current instance of the class

java_mcq_questions.question: What is a 'constructor' in Java?
options: A method used to destroy objects
A method used to access superclass members
A special method used to initialize objects
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A special method used to initialize objects

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'static' keyword used for in Java?
options: To define a variable's data type
To specify that a variable or method belongs to the class, not to instances of the class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To specify that a variable or method belongs to the class, not to instances of the class

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'final' keyword used for in Java?
options: To indicate that a class cannot be subclassed
To specify the beginning of a program
To create a new instance of a class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To indicate that a class cannot be subclassed

java_mcq_questions.question: Which operator is used for conditional (ternary) statements in Java?
What does the 'break' statement do in a Java loop?
options: Jumps to the next iteration of the loop
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: Exits the loop prematurely

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'super' keyword in Java?
options: To access the superclass of a class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To access the superclass of a class

java_mcq_questions.question: Which collection is used to store elements in a non-sequential order in Java?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: HashSet

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'try' and 'catch' blocks in Java?
options: To create an instance of a class
To print a message to the console
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To handle exceptions and errors

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'finally' block in a Java try-catch-finally construct?
options: To execute code that should always run, regardless of exceptions
To stop the execution of a program
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To execute code that should always run, regardless of exceptions

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'Java Virtual Machine' (JVM)?
options: A runtime environment for executing Java bytecode
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A runtime environment for executing Java bytecode

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'package' statement in Java?
options: To specify the name and location of the current Java file
To create a new Java project
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To specify the name and location of the current Java file

java_mcq_questions.question: What does the 'import' statement do in Java?
options: Imports a library or class for use in the current Java file
Exports the current Java file to other projects
Prints a message to the console
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: Imports a library or class for use in the current Java file

java_mcq_questions.question: Which data structure in Java allows you to store key-value pairs?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: HashMap

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of 'polymorphism' in Java?
options: To handle multiple data types using a single interface
To draw graphics on the screen
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To handle multiple data types using a single interface

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the Java keyword for creating a subclass?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: extends

java_mcq_questions.question: What is an 'applet' in Java?
options: A small Java program that runs in a web browser
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A small Java program that runs in a web browser

java_mcq_questions.question: What is a 'method signature' in Java?
options: A method's name and return type
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A method's name and return type

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'toString' method in Java?
options: To convert a string to an integer
To print a message to the console
To return a string representation of an object
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To return a string representation of an object

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the Java keyword for creating an instance of a class?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: new

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of 'garbage collection' in Java?
options: To clean up unused memory and objects
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To clean up unused memory and objects

java_mcq_questions.question: What does the 'assert' keyword do in Java?
options: Prints a message to the console
Checks if a boolean expression is true, otherwise, it throws an error
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: Checks if a boolean expression is true, otherwise, it throws an error

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'inheritance' in Java?
options: The process of creating new classes from existing classes
The process of generating random numbers
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: The process of creating new classes from existing classes

java_mcq_questions.question: Which keyword is used to define a constant in Java?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: final

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'switch' statement used for in Java?
options: To perform different actions based on different values of a variable
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To perform different actions based on different values of a variable

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'break' statement in a 'switch' block?
options: It jumps to the next iteration of the loop
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: It exits the 'switch' block prematurely

java_mcq_questions.question: Which data structure in Java is used to store elements in a sequential order?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: ArrayList

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'instanceof' operator used for in Java?
options: To create a new instance of a class
To check if an object is an instance of a particular class
To convert a string to an integer
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To check if an object is an instance of a particular class

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'method overloading' in Java?
options: Overloading a method with more parameters
Overloading a method with the same name but different parameters
Overloading a method by increasing its visibility
Overloading a method with fewer parameters
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: Overloading a method with the same name but different parameters

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'method overriding' in Java?
options: Overriding a method with more parameters
Overriding a method with the same name but different parameters
Overriding a method by increasing its visibility
Overriding a method in a subclass with the same name and parameters as in the superclass
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: Overriding a method in a subclass with the same name and parameters as in the superclass

java_mcq_questions.question: What is a 'lambda expression' in Java?
options: A way to define an anonymous class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A way to define an anonymous class

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of 'generics' in Java?
options: To specify data types at runtime
To allow for unlimited data types in a single variable
To allow for code reuse without specifying data types in advance
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To allow for code reuse without specifying data types in advance

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'this' keyword used for in Java?
options: To refer to the current instance of the class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To refer to the current instance of the class

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'exception handling' in Java?
options: Handling errors and exceptions that occur during program execution
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: Handling errors and exceptions that occur during program execution

java_mcq_questions.question: Which Java keyword is used to explicitly specify that a variable doesn't have a value?
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: null

java_mcq_questions.question: What is a 'wrapper class' in Java?
options: A class used for packaging gifts
A class that wraps primitive data types to provide additional functionality
A class that represents an abstract data type
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A class that wraps primitive data types to provide additional functionality

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'String' class in Java?
options: A class for creating strings of text
A class for printing to the console
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A class for creating strings of text

java_mcq_questions.question: What is the 'StringBuilder' class in Java used for?
options: To build string values with efficient memory usage
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: To build string values with efficient memory usage

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'JavaBeans' in Java?
options: A platform-independent component model for building reusable software components
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A platform-independent component model for building reusable software components

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'serialization' in Java?
options: A process of converting an object into a byte stream
A method for converting text to numbers
A method for converting images to text
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A process of converting an object into a byte stream

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'deserialization' in Java?
options: A method for converting images to text
A process of converting a byte stream into an object
A process of converting a byte stream into text
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A process of converting a byte stream into an object

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'reflection' in Java?
options: A way to see the code of a class
A process of examining or modifying the runtime behavior of a class
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A process of examining or modifying the runtime behavior of a class

java_mcq_questions.question: What is 'regular expression' in Java?
options: A way to express emotions in code
A pattern used to match character sequences
A method for generating random numbers
java_mcq_questions.correct_answer: A pattern used to match character sequences
